P01.department: Dept of Sports Sc & Phy Edu

-.short_title: Teaching Practice in Pri Sch 小學教學實習

description.ENG: Major students are required to take 8 units of Teaching Practice, spread over the two years of study when students are placed in a variety of schools to observe them in operation and become acquainted with the organization, planning, administration, routine and discipline of each school. They will progressively be involved in teaching groups of children until they can be responsible for whole class teaching in physical education. (For Physical Education, Exercise Science and Health Majors only)
description.ZHS: 主修生须修读教学实习科目共8学分。科目分二年修读。学生派到不同学校观察，从而认识其架构、计划、行政、一般事务及纪律之运作。学生将逐步参与小组教学活动，使最后能独立教授全班体育课程。（本科只供健康与体育运动科学主修生修读）
description.ZHT: 主修生須修讀教學實習科目共8學分。科目分二年修讀。學生派到不同學校觀察，從而認識其架構、計劃、行政、一般事務及紀律之運作。學生將逐步參與小組教學活動，使最後能獨立教授全班體育課程。（本科只供健康與體育運動科學主修生修讀）

P01.department: Dept of Sports Sc & Phy Edu

-.short_title: Internship in Sports Industry 運動產業實習

description.ENG: This course provides opportunities for students to put knowledge and skills they learned from the programme into practice via engaging in a real-life career in the sports industry.  Areas of sports industry attachment mainly focus on coaching, research, clinical attachment, health promotion and administration. Students are required to demonstrate ability in the planning, implementing, and evaluation of a project independently via an internship experience. Students are expected to observe rules, regulations, and responsibility of a regular full-time employee of the industry they are attached to. They will be evaluated based upon a collection of an internship portfolio, a written project report, a presentation and an evaluation report from the industry supervisor.
description.ZHS: 本科目旨在提供机会，让学生将所学知识和技巧应用于实际的体育产业职位。与之有关的体育产业职位主要包括：教练、科学研究、临床实践、健康推广和管理职位等。通过实习活动，学生可以展示自己独立计划、执行和评估有关项目的能力，并从实习岗位了解全职正规雇员应遵守的规章、守则和所担负的责任。学生的考核将基于其档案夹、负责项目报告书、口头报告和实习导师的评估。
description.ZHT: 本科目旨在提供機會，讓學生將所學知識和技巧應用於實際的體育產業職位。與之有關的體育產業職位主要包括：教練、科學研究、臨床實踐、健康推廣和管理職位等。通過實習活動，學生可以展示自己獨立計劃、執行和評估有關項目的能力，並從實習崗位了解全職正規雇員應遵守的規章、守則和所擔負的責任。學生的考核將基於其檔案夾、負責項目報告書、口頭報告和實習導師的評估。

-.short_title: UG Research in Science I 科研培訓（一）

description.ENG: This is an elementary research-based course that introduces current issues and/or special important foundation topics in a science discipline. Students are required to finish one of the following two tasks:1. Read and discuss readings assigned by the instructor;2. Conduct elementary tasks on a project/study/laboratory. Grade Descriptors:A/A-: Complete all assigned tasks and understand most key concepts/theories.B: Complete most of the assigned tasks and understand most key ideas.C: Complete most of the assigned tasks and understand some key ideas.D: Complete most of the assigned tasks.F: Complete less than 50% of the assigned tasks and fail to learn from the reading materials.
description.ZHS: 这是一科以研究为本的基础科目。本科涵盖与科学相关的最新信息及/或重要的科学基础概念。学生必须完成以下其中一项工作：1. 阅读导师指定的数据并加以阐释讨论；2. 完成基本的主题研习/作业/实验习作。等级说明：A/A-：完成所有习作，并能掌握大部分概念/理论。B：完成大部分习作，并能掌握大部分要点。C：完成大部分习作，并能掌握部分要点。D：完成大部分习作。F：仅完成少于50%习作及未能从数据中学习。
description.ZHT: 這是一科以研究為本的基礎科目。本科涵蓋與科學相關的最新資訊及/或重要的科學基礎概念。學生必須完成以下其中一項工作：1. 閱讀導師指定的資料並加以闡釋討論；2. 完成基本的主題研習/作業/實驗習作。等級說明：A/A-：完成所有習作，並能掌握大部分概念/理論。B：完成大部分習作，並能掌握大部分要點。C：完成大部分習作，並能掌握部分要點。D：完成大部分習作。F：僅完成少於50%習作及未能從資料中學習。

info.requirement: Pre-requisite / Co-requisite: STAR2050.

-.short_title: Seminar I 學術報告（一）

description.ENG: This course is one of the three seminar courses included in STARS. This course aims to widen students’ scope of horizon in a broad area of scientific research. Students are required to participate in research seminars or conferences. Grade Descriptors:Pass: Attend 5 seminar talks or above in science-related discipline(s) (or other approved areas) and submit a satisfactory summary report showing an understanding of the theme of the talk.Fail: Fail to meet the passing criteria.
description.ZHS: 本科是科研星耀专修范围中三科研讨科目之一。本科旨在扩阔学生对不同科研范畴的认识。学生须参与相关的研讨会或会议。等级说明：及格：参与至少五个科学（或其他已获批准的范畴）研讨会，并提交符合要求的总结报告，以展示对研讨会主题的了解。不及格：未能达到以上及格要求。
description.ZHT: 本科是科研星耀專修範圍中三科研討科目之一。本科旨在擴闊學生對不同科研範疇的認識。學生須參與相關的研討會或會議。等級說明：及格：參與至少五個科學（或其他已獲批准的範疇）研討會，並提交符合要求的總結報告，以展示對研討會主題的了解。不及格：未能達到以上及格要求。

-.short_title: Seminar II 學術報告（二）

description.ENG: This course is one of the three seminar courses included in STARS. This course aims to widen students’ scope of horizon in a broad area of scientific research. Students are required to participate in research seminars or conferences. Grade Descriptors:Pass: Attend 5 seminar talks or above in science-related discipline(s) (or other approved areas) and submit a satisfactory summary report showing a grasp of the major methodology of the talk.Fail: Fail to meet the passing criteria.
description.ZHS: 本科是科研星耀专修范围中三科研讨科目之一。本科旨在扩阔学生对不同科研范畴的认识。学生须参与相关的研讨会或会议。等级说明：及格：参与至少五个科学（或其他已获批准的范畴）的研讨会，并提交符合要求的总结报告，以展示对研讨会主题研究方法的了解。不及格：未能达到以上及格要求。
description.ZHT: 本科是科研星耀專修範圍中三科研討科目之一。本科旨在擴闊學生對不同科研範疇的認識。學生須參與相關的研討會或會議。等級說明：及格：參與至少五個科學（或其他已獲批准的範疇）的研討會，並提交符合要求的總結報告，以展示對研討會主題研究方法的了解。不及格：未能達到以上及格要求。

info.requirement: Pre-requisite / Co-requisite: STAR2050.

-.short_title: Intro to Prog Lang for Sta 統計電腦語言導論

description.ENG: This course aims at providing students with basic knowledge of programming in R. A problem-solving approach will be employed. Algorithm development and implementation with emphasis on examples and applications in statistics will be discussed.
description.ZHS: 本科目的是为学生提供编写R电脑语言之基本知识。本科采用问题解决之教学方法。内容包括算法之编写及执行，特别强调在统计学上之例子及应用。
description.ZHT: 本科目的是為學生提供編寫R電腦語言之基本知識。本科採用問題解決之教學方法。內容包括算法之編寫及執行，特別強調在統計學上之例子及應用。

title.ENG: Introduction to Programming Language for Statistics

A.short_title: Thai I 泰語（一）

B.short_title: Thai I 泰語（一）

description.ENG: This course invites students without prior knowledge of Thai to explore the basic features of the Thai language. Supported by audiovisual aids, students will receive intensive practice in spoken and written Thai through interactive class work, homework and online exercises. They will become familiar with the basic concepts of Thai grammar and learn how to interact in some simple everyday situations.
description.ZHS: 本科为初学法语的学生而设，教授泰语的基础知识。通过视听教材的辅助，以及互动式课堂作业、家庭作业和网上练习，学生将会得到法语口语和书面语的强化训练。学生将通过本科学习法语基础语法，以及如何以法语应对简单的生活场景。
description.ZHT: 本科為初學法語的學生而設，教授泰語的基礎知識。通過視聽教材的輔助，以及互動式課堂作業、家庭作業和網上練習，學生將會得到法語口語和書面語的強化訓練。學生將通過本科學習法語基礎語法，以及如何以法語應對簡單的生活場景。

info.requirement: Not for students who have taken THAI2000(1002),2001,2050(1010) or 3000

-.short_title: Hebrew I 希伯來文（一）

description.ENG: A study of elementary Hebrew vocabulary and grammar. The aim is to prepare students to read simple short sentences in the Hebrew Bible.
description.ZHS: 本科讲授初级希伯来文词汇及文法，以培养学生阅读希伯来文圣经简单短句之能力。
description.ZHT: 本科講授初級希伯來文詞彙及文法，以培養學生閱讀希伯來文聖經簡單短句之能力。

-.short_title: Field Education I 實習（一）

description.ENG: Students will be arranged to join internship programmes offered by churches or church organizations. The overall aims are to help students gain insights into how theory be integrated with practice, learn to read living experience, learn to do theological reflection, understand how one’s self has shaped his/her ministry, examine his/her own vocational calling, acquire basic ministerial skills.
description.ZHS: 透过在教会或基督宗教组织实习，协助学生尝试整合神学理论于牧养实践中、学习阅读活生生之经验、学习进行有系统之神学反省、检视作为实践者的自我如何影响个人之牧养模态、反思个人召命、增进牧养技巧。
description.ZHT: 透過在教會或基督宗教組織實習，協助學生嘗試整合神學理論於牧養實踐中、學習閱讀活生生之經驗、學習進行有系統之神學反省、檢視作為實踐者的自我如何影響個人之牧養模態、反思個人召命、增進牧養技巧。

-.short_title: Field Education II 實習（二）

description.ENG: Students will be arranged to join internship programmes offered by churches or church organizations. The overall aims are to help students gain insights into how theory be integrated with practice, learn to read living experience, learn to do theological reflection, understand how one’s self has shaped his/her ministry, examine his/her own vocational calling, acquire basic ministerial skills.
description.ZHS: 透过在教会或基督宗教组织实习，协助学生尝试整合神学理论于牧养实践中、学习阅读活生生之经验、学习进行有系统之神学反省、检视作为实践者的自我如何影响个人之牧养模态、反思个人召命、增进牧养技巧。
description.ZHT: 透過在教會或基督宗教組織實習，協助學生嘗試整合神學理論於牧養實踐中、學習閱讀活生生之經驗、學習進行有系統之神學反省、檢視作為實踐者的自我如何影響個人之牧養模態、反思個人召命、增進牧養技巧。

A.short_title: Outline of Chinese Culture 中國文化要義

B.short_title: Outline of Chinese Culture 中國文化要義

description.ENG: This course aims to provide a general understanding of traditional Chinese culture. It covers the following core topics: characteristics of Chinese culture; Chinese thought; and Chinese political, social, and economic life. Other topics may also be covered, such as Chinese religion, science and technology in traditional China, the Chinese intelligentsia, and so on.
description.ZHS: 本科旨在让学生对传统中国文化有一综括的认识。内容包括下列的基本专题：中国文化之特质、中国思想以及中国政治、社会与经济生活。另外一些专题如中国宗教、古代中国的科学与技术及中国知识分子等亦会涉及。
description.ZHT: 本科旨在讓學生對傳統中國文化有一綜括的認識。內容包括下列幾個主要專題：中國文化之特質；中國思想；以及中國政治、社會與經濟生活。另外一些專題如中國宗教、古代中國的科學與技術及中國知識分子等亦會涉及。

info.requirement:
Not for Philosophy Majors and students who have taken IASP2550 or UGEA2110.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Mainstream Chinese Phi Thought 中國哲學主流思想

description.ENG: The course introduces the philosophical thought of Confucianism, Taoism, and Buddhism, so as to give students a deeper understanding of the roots of Chinese values and culture. As a cornerstone of Chinese culture, Confucianism contributes to the establishment of the human moral way by articulating a conception of humans as moral subjects. Taoism stresses the pursuit of an ideal life by understanding the changes of the universe, while Buddhism applies the concept of karma to show how the ultimate cause of human suffering lies in ignorance. Other Chinese philosophical thought such as Mohism, Legalism, and the School of Yin and Yang may also be covered.* This course has tutorial teaching, but topics are the same as in UGEA2150.
description.ZHS: 内容将引介儒、道、佛三家的哲学思想，以了解中国文化的深层结构。儒家之贡献在确立人极，肯定人的道德主体性；道家在明事变，上通道境；而佛家则明业识，把握生命中的无明性。其他中国哲学思想如墨家、法家及阴阳家等亦会涉及。     *本科与 UGA2150的讲授范围大致相同，但讲授内容较详细，或设有导修课。
description.ZHT: 內容將引介儒、道、佛三家的哲學思想，以瞭解中國文化的深層結構。儒家之貢獻在確立人極，肯定人的道德主體性；道家在明事變，上通道境；而佛家則明業識，把握生命中的無明性。其他中國哲學思想如墨家、法家及陰陽家等亦會涉及。* 本科設有導修課，講授內容與 UGEA2150大致相同。

info.requirement:
Not for Philosophy Majors and students who have taken UGEA2150, PHIL2020 or PHIL2030.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Chinese Culture and Society 中國文化與社會

description.ENG: (UGEA2180 is double-coded with ANTH2410.) This course provides an anthropological approach to China. Discussions concentrate on major cultural and social institutions of China, both traditional and contemporary, such as family, marriage, kinship, lineage and clan, economic system, religion and value orientation.
description.ZHS: （UGEA2180与ANTH2410列为双重编号科目。）    本科目对传统及当代中国的主要文化及社会制度如亲属、宗族、社会阶级、婚姻、家族、经济制度、宗教及价值观等作深入讨论，并讨论现代人类学中有关社会结构的研究方法及理论在研究中国社会上的适用程度。
description.ZHT: （UGEA2180與ANTH2410列為雙重編號科目。）本科目對傳統及當代中國的主要文化及社會制度如親屬、宗族、社會階級、婚姻、家族、經濟制度、宗教及價值觀等作深入討論，並討論現代人類學中有關社會結構的研究方法及理論在研究中國社會上的適用程度。

info.requirement:
Not for Anthropology Majors and students who have taken ANTH2410.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

description.ENG: This course will introduce students to a variety of social science concepts and theories to analyse contemporary China from an integrated perspective. After taking this course, students should be able to grasp the current development in key areas of China including economic reform, political system and change, rural and urban development, social inequality, family and marriage, cultural and ideological issues, as well as other institutional developments.
description.ZHS: 本科将运用社会科学的概念和理论，以综合学科的视野分析当代中国社会。学生在修读本科後，应能掌握当前中国的经济改革、政治制度及变迁、农村与城市发展、贫富不均、家庭与婚姻、文化与意识形态，乃至於其他制度变迁。
description.ZHT: 本科將運用社會科學的概念和理論，以綜合學科的視野分析當代中國社會。學生在修讀本科後，應能掌握當前中國的經濟改革、政治制度及變遷、農村與城市發展、貧富不均、家庭與婚姻、文化與意識形態，乃至於其他制度變遷。

info.requirement:
Not for Sociology Majors and students who have taken GESC2118, SOCI2117(1101) or UGEA2300.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Energy and Green Society 能源與綠色社會

description.ENG: This course is designed to help students to acquire a comprehensive understanding of the global energy crisis and environmental issues our society is currently facing. The history of energy consumption shows how important energy is to the quality of life for the human beings. With the further development and the increase of the world population, our society is challenged by an unprecedented energy demand in 21st century. At the same time, the global warming and climate changes are also causing more and more attentions. How can we meet the future energy demand? What are the energy options we currently have and what are their impacts on the environment? How can we meet our energy needs without deteriorating the environment? The first half of this course will tackle the above-raised questions by examining our current energy options and their respective impacts on the environment. Then, to address both the energy and environmental concerns, possible routes to develop a green society will be discussed in the second half of this course with a focus on renewable energy resources, smart grid, eco-friendly vehicles, and carbon sequestration and carbon audit. (No technical background is required)
description.ZHS: 本科的宗旨是为学生提供一个了解人类社会所面临的全球能源危机以及环境问题的机会。历史表明能源消耗与人类的生活质量息息相关。由于生活水平的进一步提高和世界人口的增长，现代社会正面临着前所未有的能源需求的挑战。同时全球变暖和气候变化也引起人们越来越多的关注。如何能够满足未来的能源需求？目前有哪些能源选择以及它们对环境有何影响？如何能够在不危害环境的前提下满足我们的能源需求？本科的上半部分将通过考察我们目前的能源选择以及它们对环境的影响来试图回答上述所提出的问题。为了同时应对能源和环境问题，本科的下半部分主要介绍发展绿色社会的各种途径包括可再生能源、智能电网、环保汽车以及碳隔离和碳审计。(不须具备技术背景)
description.ZHT: 本科的宗旨是為學生提供一個了解人類社會所面臨的全球能源危機以及環境問題的機會。歷史表明能源消耗與人類的生活質量息息相關。由於生活水平的進一步提高和世界人口的增長，現代社會正面臨著前所未有的能源需求的挑戰。同時全球變暖和氣候變化也引起人們越來越多的關注。如何能夠滿足未來的能源需求？目前有哪些能源選擇以及它們對環境有何影響？如何能夠在不危害環境的前提下滿足我們的能源需求？本科的上半部分將通過考察我們目前的能源選擇以及它們對環境的影響來試圖回答上述所提出的問題。為了同時應對能源和環境問題，本科的下半部分主要介紹發展綠色社會的各種途徑包括可再生能源、智能電網、環保汽車以及碳隔離和碳審計。(不須具備技術背景)

info.requirement:
Not for Mechanical and Automation Engineering Majors and students who have taken ENGG1500.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Plants for Treasure & Pleasure 植物創富及添趣

description.ENG: This course aims to provide an overview of the biodiversity of plants (also including algae, bacteria and fungi) and their applications as 1) food and nutrients; 2) clothing and construction materials; 3) drugs and functional food; 4) landscaping and environment remedy stuffs; 5) hallucinogenic and narcotic agents; 6) fuels and energy; and 7) feeds, fertilizers and pesticides. The discoveries and economic applications of plants will be further discussed and reviewed, through comparing the traditional and scientific approaches of using plants, and introducing the innovation methods, genetically modified foods, and commodity markets.
description.ZHS: 本科概述植物的生物多样性（亦包括藻类、细菌和真菌）及其作为下列各项之应用    一）食物和营养、  二）衣料和建材、  三）药物和功能食品、  四）环境美化和修护素材、  五）迷幻药和成瘾毒品、  六）燃料和能源、  七）饲料、肥料和除莠剂等。    本科亦涵盖植物开发及利用的背境资科及讨论，例如比较和用植物的传统及科学方法之异同，及创新方法之应用等；其中包括绿色革命、基因改造食物、期货市场等课题。
description.ZHT: 本科概述植物的生物多樣性（亦包括藻類、細菌和真菌）及其作為下列各項之應用一）食物和營養、二）衣料和建材、三）藥物和功能食品、四）環境美化和修護素材、五）迷幻藥和成癮毒品、六）燃料和能源、七）飼料、肥料和除莠劑等。本科亦涵蓋植物開發及利用的背境資科及討論，例如比較和用植物的傳統及科學方法之異同，及創新方法之應用等；其中包括綠色革命、基因改造食物、期貨市場等課題。

info.requirement:
Not for School of Life Sciences, Chinese Medicine and Natural Sciences Majors in YBSC, YBTC, YENS and YFNC concentrations
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Great Discoveries in Life Sci 生命科學大發現

description.ENG: This course aims at deciphering how the discoveries by the work of some famous scientists in the field of life sciences has affected our daily life and our society. The course first provides students with the general knowledge of some basic processes in life, followed by how this knowledge has helped us to cope with the natural adversities such as diseases. The improvements of our quality of life by the biotechnological advances and how the development in life sciences has revolutionized our lives in life sciences will also be discussed. Finally, how the development in life sciences has brought revolutionizing impacts on our lives, civilization, and modernization will be presented. Through a series of learning activities, students are encouraged to comprehend and to connect the discoveries in life sciences to daily scenarios. This course is particularly suitable for students who are not life-science or medicine majors and who want to understand more on how discoveries in life sciences have transformed the way we think and live throughout the centuries.
description.ZHS: 本科旨于探讨一些卓越生命科学学家的研究成果及其科学意念如何影响现代人类的生活及社会发展。课程内容首先介绍一些生命运作的基本概念，进而谈及生命科学如何帮助人类抵御疾病等自然灾害。最后，课堂将进一步演绎那些生命科学的理论如何被应用，进而对现今社会作出贡献。同学可以透过不同的课堂学习活动，增进了解这些当代重要的科学发明如何对人类生活及其对科研工作带来革命性的影响及反思。本课特别适合非主修生命科学及医学课程的同学，让他们进一步了解生命科学的发现如何对我们日常生活带来深远的影响。
description.ZHT: 本科旨於探討一些卓越生命科學學家的研究成果及其科學意念如何影響現代人類的生活及社會發展。課程內容首先介紹一些生命運作的基本概念，進而談及生命科學如何幫助人類抵禦疾病等自然災害。最後，課堂將進一步演繹那些生命科學的理論如何被應用，進而對現今社會作出貢獻。同學可以透過不同的課堂學習活動，增進了解這些當代重要的科學發明如何對人類生活及其對科研工作帶來革命性的影響及反思。本課特別適合非主修生命科學及醫學課程的同學，讓他們進一步了解生命科學的發現如何對我們日常生活帶來深遠的影響。

info.requirement:
Not for Sch of LSCI, Fac of Med, BMEG & NSCI Major in YBSC, YBTC, YENS & YFNC and students taken BCHE2030,3030, 3080, BIOL2120, BMEG2000,2010 or LSCI1002.
Co-requisite:UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Nutrition for Healthy Living 營養與健康生活

description.ENG: This course aims at providing students with majors in other academic (non-life sciences, non-medical) disciplines with an overview of nutritional sciences and their applications for everyday life and health issues.  The course is composed of 4 themes.  Theme 1 will introduce basic concepts of nutritional sciences and the nutritional needs/concerns at different stages of life in humans.  Theme 2 will address the relationship between nutrition and some common nutrition-related diseases.  Weight management and meal planning will also be included in theme 2.  Theme 3 will discuss some diet and nutrition controversial issues, such as the effectiveness of popular diets.  Theme 4 will cover some selected local and global nutritional issues.
description.ZHS: 本课程目的为其它学科背景的学生(不包括生命科学及医学主修生)提供一些基本的营养知识及其日常生活和健康问题的应用。本课程由四个主题组成。主题一：介绍营养学的基本概念以及在人类不同成长阶段的营养需要和所需关注事项。主题二：谈及营养摄取与一些常见疾病的关系，当中包括体重管理和餐单设计。主题三：讨论在坊间流传的饮食和营养学观点或理论，如不同餐单的功效等。主题四：谈及本地及全球的一些被受关注的营养问题。
description.ZHT: 本科目的為其他學科背景的學生(不包括生命科學及醫學主修生)提供一些基本的營養知識及其日常生活和健康問題的應用。本課程由四個主題組成。主題一：介紹營養學的基本概念以及在人類不同成長階段的營養需要和所需關注事項。主題二：談及營養攝取與一些常見疾病的關係，當中包括體重管理和餐單設計。主題三：討論在坊間流傳的飲食和營養學觀點或理論，如不同餐單的功效等。主題四：談及本地及全球的一些被受關注的營養問題。

info.requirement:
Not for Fac of Medicine, School of Life Sciences, Biomedical Engineering Majors and Natural Sciences Majors in YBSC, YBTC, YENS and YFNC concentrations.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Food Safety & Processing Tech 食品安全與製作科技

description.ENG: In modern cities, a wide assortment of food products is available in the markets and consumers are able to enjoy these delicious foods conveniently and safely. Behind the scenes of food enjoyment, lots of science and technology has been applied in their manufacturing processes to ensure that the food products are preserved in high standards of quality, nutrition and safety. Among those food manufacturing and processing methods, however, some of them are quite controversial and thus arouse many public concerns over food safety and security issues.  This course is designed for the general students to provide them with some key concepts and scientific knowledge in food preservation, processing technology and food safety control, as well as to explore the interactive relationships between them. Through learning the basic properties of foodborne hazards, which are the origins of most food safety problems, students are able to enhance the understandings on the principles and practices of respective food preservation methods and processing technologies. Meanwhile, the potential risks and adverse effects of particular food processing technologies will be discussed. Furthermore, some highly concerning topics and incidents about food safety will be analysed based on scientific facts and discussed from different perspectives. After finishing the course, students are encouraged to use the acquired knowledge to make better food choices, distinguish the fallacies about food and appraise the impact of modern technology on human food safety and security.
description.ZHS: 在现代都市，消费者可以在食品市场中选购各式各样的食物加工制品，及能够很安全且方便地享用这些美食。在享用美食的背后，这些食品的在生产过程中其实涉及了很多科学知识与科技的应用，以确保这些食品在质量、营养和安全上均能够保存在高质的水平。然而在众多食品生产和处理方法当中，有一些是颇具争议，因而引起了社会大众对现今食品安全和粮食问题的关注。本科目专为普通同学开设，旨在教授一些关于现代食品保质、加工科技和食品安全控制的主要概念和基本科学知识，以及探讨它们之间的相互关系。同学可通过认识各种食品安全问题的根本源头–「食源性危害」的基本属性，从而理解各种针对性的食品保质方法和加工技术的原理和操作。同时，课堂亦会探讨一些特殊食品加工技术的潜在风险和不良影响，并会以科学为依据，对一些受到特别关注的食品安全事件进行分析，以及从不同的观点角度作出讨论和理解。希望同学在修毕科目之后，能够在日常生活中应用到相关知识，更明智地选择食物之外，更可理智地分辨一些关于食物的谬见与真相，并合理评价现今科技对人类食品安全和粮食问题的影响。
description.ZHT: 在現代都市，消費者可以在食品市場中選購琳瑯滿目的食物加工製品，及能夠很安全且方便地享用這些美食。在享用美食的背後，這些食品的在生產過程中其實涉及了很多科學知識與科技的應用，以確保這些食品在品質、營養和安全上均能夠保存在高質數的水平。然而在眾多食品生產和處理方法當中，有一些是頗具爭議的，也因而引起了社會大眾對現今食品安全和糧食問題的關注。	本科目特別為一般同學而開設，旨在教授一些關於現代食品保質、加工科技和食品安全控制的主要概念和基本科學知識，以及探討它們之間的互動關係。同學可透過認識各種食品安全問題的根本源頭–「食源性危害」的基本屬性，從而理解各種針對性的食品保質方法和加工技術的原理和操作。同時，課堂亦會探討一些特殊食品加工技術的潛在風險和不良影響，並會以科學為依據，對一些特別受關注的食品安全事件進行分析，以及從不同的觀點角度作出討論和理解。希望同學在修畢科目後，能夠在日常生活中應用到相關知識，更明智地選擇食物之餘，還可理智地辨別一些關於食物的謬見與真相，並合理評價現今科技對人類食品安全和糧食問題的影響。

info.requirement:
Not for Faculty of Medicine, School of Life Sciences Majors and Natural Sciences Majors in YBSC, YBTC, YENS and YFNC concentrations.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

C.short_title: Astronomy 天文學

description.ENG: A qualitative and non-mathematical survey of major ideas in astronomy. Topics covered will include: earth and sky, moon, calendar and time keeping, origin of modern astronomy, light and telescope, starlight and atoms, the sun, binary stars and their significance, stellar evolution, neutron stars and black holes, Milky Way, galaxies, quasars, the structure of the universe, solar system, meteorites, asteroids and comets. This course will include one night observation. This course aims at introducing basic concepts rather than mathematical and factual details. Lectures are designed not only to present a volume of knowledge, but also to arouse students' curiosity in how nature works. Optional star-gazing trips as well as visits to Hong Kong Space Museum will be arranged.
description.ZHS: 本科旨在介绍天文学的主要观念，采取定性讨论，不作数学推演。所述内容包括：地球及天象、月亮、历法、计时、近代天文学的起源、光及望远镜、星光与原子的关系、太阳、双星及其重要性、星体演变、中子星、黑洞、银河系、星云、类星体、宇宙结构、太阳系、陨石、小行星及彗星。本科包括一晚观星活动。本科旨在介绍基本概念而非详细之数理内容，将不单提供天文知识，更希望能引发学生对大自然运行之兴趣。老师亦将安排自由参加之观星活动及香港太空馆参观。
description.ZHT: 本科旨在介紹天文學的主要觀念，採取定性討論，不作數學推演。所述內容包括：地球及天象、月亮、曆法、計時、近代天文學的起源、光及望遠鏡、星光與原子的關係、太陽、雙星及其重要性、星體演變、中子星、黑洞、銀河系、星雲、類星體、宇宙結構、太陽系、隕石、小行星及彗星。本科包括一晚觀星活動。本科旨在介紹基本概念而非詳細之數理內容，將不單提供天文知識，更希望能引發學生對大自然運行之興趣。老師亦將安排自由參加之觀星活動及香港太空館參觀。

info.requirement:
Not for Physics Majors, Natural Sciences Majors in YPSC concentration and students who have taken PHYS2401, 2910 or UGEB2402 or 2510.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Origins – From Cosmos to Life 起源：從宇宙到生命

description.ENG: The course aims at providing an introduction to the formation of the cosmos and the origin of life from an astrophysical perspective. The journey starts from the origin of the universe, and leads us through all the intermediate milestones such as the appearance of matter, the formation of galaxies, the formation of stars and planets, the appearance of simple life forms, and the evolution of life on Earth. Students can thus develop a complete picture of the current understanding of the emergence of life in the cosmos, and gain perspectives of the scientific method that allows us to arrive at the knowledge.
description.ZHS: 本科旨在概览从天文学的角度对宇宙形成和生物起源的理解。我们从宇宙起源谈起，探讨其后各个里程碑，例如物质的来源、星系形成、恒星和行星的产生、原始生物的出现、地球上的生物演化。本课程旨在让同学完整地了解生命在宇宙中出现的过程，以及明了科学方法如何让我们获得这些知识。
description.ZHT: 本科旨在概覽從天文學的角度對宇宙形成和生物起源的理解。我們從宇宙起源談起，探討其後各個里程碑，例如物質的來源、星系形成、恆星和行星的產生、原始生物的出現、地球上的生物演化。本課程旨在讓同學完整地了解生命在宇宙中出現的過程，以及明瞭科學方法如何讓我們獲得這些知識。

info.requirement:
Not for Physics Majors, Natural Sciences Majors in YPSC concentration and students who have taken PHYS2401, 2910, UGEB2401 or 2510.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

B.short_title: Games and Strategic Thinking 博奕和策略思想

description.ENG: The aim of this course is to study games and strategies from the mathematical perspective. We investigate the manner in which rational people interact when there are competitions. This applies to parlour games and more importantly to economy, social psychology, politics and business. We will introduce the great discoveries of Von Neumann and Nash, and discuss their impact on society. Also, we will use examples of various types of games to illustrate how some basic mathematical methods can lead to optimal strategies for decision making.
description.ZHS: 本科旨在从数学的观点研究博奕与策略。我们探讨在竞争的环境下，理性的局内人互动的方式。这可应用到普通博奕中，而它对经济、社会心理、政治，以及商业中的决策有更重要的作用。我们将介绍 Von Neumann和 Nash的一些重大发现，并讨论它们对社会的影响。同时，我们会运用各种对策的例子，说明怎样使用基础的数学方法，以拟定决策的最佳策略。
description.ZHT: 本科旨在從數學的觀點研究博奕與策略。我們探討在競爭的環境下，理性的局內人互動的方式。這可應用到普通博奕中，而它對經濟、社會心理、政治，以及商業中的決策有更重要的作用。我們將介紹 Von Neumann和 Nash的一些重大發現，並討論它們對社會的影響。同時，我們會運用各種對策的例子，說明怎樣使用基礎的數學方法，以擬定決策的最佳策略。

info.requirement:
Not for MATH, MAIE and MIEG, BMED Majors, NSCI Majors in Mathematical Sciences Concentration and students who have taken ECON3160 or MATH4250.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum)

-.short_title: Fundamentals in Chi Med 中醫與中藥

description.ENG: This course introduces the fundamental concepts in Chinese medicine to students who are interested in a general understanding of the basic theories, working principles, methods for health preservation and disease healing in Chinese medicine. The course comprises an introduction to the five key areas in Chinese medicine including the basic theories of Chinese medicine, methods of diagnosis and treatment, acupuncture and moxibustion, Chinese medicinal materials, and Chinese herbal formulary. This general education module will also feature a half-day visit to the Chinese Medicine Clinical Research and Services Centre, TWGHs Kwong Wah Hospital - The Chinese University of Hong Kong, where the students will learn about how Chinese medicine is practised in a contemporary context. The medium of instruction for the course is English.
description.ZHS: 本科主要介绍中医药学的主要概念，使学生对中医药保健的原则和方法，得到广泛的认识。本科的内容包括中医学理论、中医诊疗方法、针灸、中药和方剂等五个方面。本科其中一个特色，是参观香港中文大学-广华医院中医药临床研究服务中心。通过实地参观，学生将更加了解中医在当今的应用。本科将以英语主讲。
description.ZHT: 本科主要介紹中醫藥學的主要概念，使學生對中醫藥保健的原則和方法，得到廣泛的認識。本科的內容包括中醫學理論、中醫診療方法、針灸、中藥和方劑等五個方面。本科其中一個特色，是參觀香港中文大學-廣華醫院中醫藥臨床研究服務中心。通過實地參觀，學生將更加了解中醫在當今的應用。本科將以英語主講。

info.requirement:
Not for Chinese Medicine Majors.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

E.short_title: Jas Pop Cul in Cul Global 日本流行文化與文化全球化

description.ENG: (UGEC1271 is double-coded with JASP1160.) This course examines the development and academic significance of various forms of Japanese popular culture such as films, comics, music, TV dramas and culinary culture, from multidisciplinary perspectives, including history, cultural anthropology, cultural studies and media studies. It aims to deepen understanding the following three facets of Japanese popular culture:1) the applicaton of cultural globalization theory in Japan; 2) the global strategy of Japanese cultural industries; and 3) social and intellectual transformation of contemporary Japanese society. Using concrete examples and grounding on representative academic writings, this course discusses the globalization of Japanese popular culture and relevant issues in indigenization, glocalization, hybridization, transnational cultural flows and media-mix. Students are trained to understand the nature and cultural implications of Japanese popular culture in an Asian context. Besides lectures, discussions and readings, this course selectively utilizes topical essays (projects), e-learning, audio-visual materials and fieldwork-based assignments as supplementary teaching tools.
description.ZHS: （UGEC1271与JASP1160列为双重编号科目。）    本科目从历史学、文化人类学、文化研究及传媒研究等跨学科角度对电影、动漫、音乐、电视剧、时装及饮食等日本流行文化的发展、现状及影响作导论性学术分析。旨在透过流行文化去了解︰  一）文化全球化理论在日本的实践；  二）日本文化产业的全球化策略；及  三）当代日本社会与精神的变迁。透过具体例子及近年代表性的学术著作去探讨有关全球化对日本流行文化的冲击及在此过程中呈现的本地化、全球在地化、杂种化、跨国合作及跨媒体化等社会文化现象。希望启发同学超越个人兴趣，能够从历史及文化等角度去思考对香港及亚洲影响深远的日本流行文化本质及其背后的文化意义。除讲义、讨论及参考文献外，本科目会选择性地使用专题习作、网上学习（e-learning）、影视教材及实地考察等作为辅助教学。
description.ZHT: （UGEC1271與JASP1160列為雙重編號科目。）本科目從歷史學、文化人類學、文化研究及傳媒研究等跨學科角度對電影、動漫、音樂、電視劇、時裝及飲食等日本流行文化的發展、現狀及影響作導論性學術分析。旨在透過流行文化去瞭解︰一）文化全球化理論在日本的實踐；二）日本文化產業的全球化策略；及三）當代日本社會與精神的變遷。透過具體例子及近年代表性的學術著作去探討有關全球化對日本流行文化的衝擊及在此過程中呈現的本地化、全球在地化、雜種化、跨國合作及跨媒體化等社會文化現象。希望啟發同學超越個人興趣，能夠從歷史及文化等角度去思考對香港及亞洲影響深遠的日本流行文化本質及其背後的文化意義。除講義、討論及參考文獻外，本科目會選擇性地使用專題習作、網上學習（e-learning）、影視教材及實地考察等作為輔助教學。

info.requirement:
Not for Japanese Studies Majors and students who have taken JASP1110 or 1160.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

title.ENG: Japanese Popular Culture in Cultural Globalization
title.ZHS: 日本流行文化与文化全球化
title.ZHT: 日本流行文化與文化全球化

-.short_title: Government & Politics of China 中國政府與政治

description.ENG: (UGEC1540 is double-coded with GPAD1070.) This is an introductory course that surveys key issues in Chinese politics, including the historical background of the system, the roles of the party/state, the style of leadership, the forms of popular participation, and the distinctive features of Chinese politics. The focus of this course is political change. Classic essays by Sun Yatsen, Lu Xun, Mao Zedong and others provide students with grounding in the key problems modern China has faced, as well as the solutions it has pioneered. From that foundation, we will move on to contemporary institutions and intellectual debates over inequality, human rights, and the future shape of political reform in China.
description.ZHS: （UGEC1540与GPAD1070列为双重编号科目。）    本科目审视中国政治的重要议题，包括体制的历史背景、政党与国家的角色、领导层的作风、民众参与、以及中国政治的特色。而本科目会集中在政治转变方面。  孙中山、鲁迅、毛泽东及其它经典论说令学生认识现代中国问题及其解决方法。此外，我们会了解现时制度及知识界对中国的不公平、人权及未来政治改革模式的争论。虽然本科目将从中国的观点去了解问题，但均以历史及比较方向去研究所 有问题。于科目重点上，我们更以国外专家的见解去细看分析比较，藉此以其它观点去了解中国政治。
description.ZHT: （UGEC1540與GPAD1070列為雙重編號科目。）本科目審視中國政治的重要議題，包括體制的歷史背景、政黨與國家的角色、領導層的作風、民眾參與、以及中國政治的特色。而本科目會集中在政治轉變方面。孫中山、鲁迅、毛澤東及其他經典論說令學生認識現代中國問題及其解決方法。此外，我們會了解現時制度及知識界對中國的不公平、人權及未來政治改革模式的爭論。雖然本科目將從中國的觀點去了解問題，但均以歷史及比較方向去研究所 有問題。於科目重點上，我們更以國外專家的見解去細看分析比較，藉此以其他觀點去了解中國政治。

info.requirement:
Not for Government and Public Administration Majors and students who have taken GPAD1070.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

C.short_title: Sociology and Modern Society 社會學與現代社會

description.ENG: (UGEC1823 is double-coded with SOCI1102.)This course explores into the significance of sociological perspectives in understanding modern society. Attention will be given to the application of sociological concepts in the observation and analysis of social phenomena in modern society. The course is designed particularly to develop intellectual skills, as part of a student's general education, for a better understanding of the nature of modern society.
description.ZHS: （UGEC1823与SOCI1102列为双重编号科目。）本科旨在探讨社会学观点在了解现代社会中的重要性，着重应用社会学的概念来观察和分析现代社会的各种现象。作为通识教育的一部分，本科旨在培养学生的思考能力，让他们对现代社会的性质有进一步的认识。
description.ZHT: （UGEC1823與SOCI1102列為雙重編號科目。）本科旨在探討社會學觀點在了解現代社會中的重要性，著重應用社會學的概念來觀察和分析現代社會的各種現象。作為通識教育的一部分，本科旨在培養學生的思考能力，讓他們對現代社會的性質有進一步的認識。

info.requirement:
Not for Sociology Majors and students who have taken SOCI1001 or SOCI1102.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Culture of Hong Kong 香港的文化

description.ENG: (UGEC1835 is double-coded with ANTH1410.) This course introduces students to characteristic aspects of Hong Kong culture. It will cover a wide range of cultural changes that have taken place since WWII. The course starts with an introduction to anthropological research in Hong Kong, and looks at topics including village culture and urbanization, food culture, marriage, family and gender, religion, and popular culture. Underlying most topics are questions of the modern versus the traditional, rural versus urban, cosmopolitan versus parochial, and how all these opposites interact to construct culture in Hong Kong.
description.ZHS: （UGEC1835与ANTH1410列为双重编号科目。）    本科为同学介绍认识香港文化特色的多种角度，尤其着重二次大战后香港的文化发展。由香港的人类学研究开始，本科探讨课题如乡村文化与都市化，饮食文化，婚姻、家庭和性别关系、宗教和流行文化等；并探讨其中现代与传统、乡村与都市、世界性与地域性等的相对关系，及以上因素如何互动并建构香港文化。
description.ZHT: （UGEC1835與ANTH1410列為雙重編號科目。）本科為同學介紹認識香港文化特色的多種角度，尤其著重二次大戰後香港的文化發展。由香港的人類學研究開始，本科探討課題如鄉村文化與都市化，飲食文化，婚姻、家庭和性別關係、宗教和流行文化等；並探討其中現代與傳統、鄉村與都市、世界性與地域性等的相對關係，及以上因素如何互動並建構香港文化。

info.requirement:
Not for Anthropology Majors and students who have taken ANTH1410.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Big Issues of Globalization 全球化大議題

description.ENG: In this course we will review the major issues surrounding the process of globalization in the contemporary world.  We will get behind these issues and discuss the backgrounds, manifestations, and implications of these issues on global development.  Issues including the economic globalization, the global financial system and crisis, political governance and globalization, social impacts of globalization, the globalization of culture, the environment and globalization and anti-globalization movement will be covered, but additional issues and special topics may be added when necessary.  The social scientific theories of globalization will serve as a background for our discussions but we are also going to emphasize the relevance of globalization to our everyday life.
description.ZHS: 本科旨在探讨全球化於经济、政治、社会等方面的影响与全球发展的关系。透过讨论不同议题，如：全球金融体系与经济危机、国际间政治角力、环境与保育争论、文化全球化、反全球化运动，以及其他当下的议题等，让同学更深入了解与人们息息相关的世界大事，并学习以社会科学角度分析全球化於不同事件中的呈现方式和深层意义。
description.ZHT: 本科旨在探討全球化於經濟、政治、社會等方面的影響與全球發展的關係。透過討論不同議題，如：全球金融體系與經濟危機、國際間政治角力、環境與保育爭論、文化全球化、反全球化運動，以及其他當下的議題等，讓同學更深入了解與人們息息相關的世界大事，並學習以社會科學角度分析全球化於不同事件中的呈現方式和深層意義。

info.requirement:
Not for Sociology Majors and students who have taken GESC2060, GEWS2091, SOCI3230(2215) or SOCI4203(3201).
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Chinese Foreign Policy 中國外交政策

description.ENG: (UGEC2531 is double-coded with GPAD2350.)Analytic study of motivations, objectives, means, manifestations and consequences of Chinese foreign policy. Discussion of Chinese foreign policy-making apparatus, procedures and styles. China’s role in the contemporary world and outstanding foreign policy problems facing China.
description.ZHS: （UGEC2531与GPAD2350列为双重编号科目。）    研究分析中国外交政策之动机、目的、手段、表现及影响；讨论其外交政策制定的机关、程序及其作风；中国在当代世界局势中之角色及其所面临之重要外交政策问题。
description.ZHT: （UGEC2531與GPAD2350列為雙重編號科目。）研究分析中國外交政策之動機、目的、手段、表現及影響；討論其外交政策制定的機關、程序及其作風；中國在當代世界局勢中之角色及其所面臨之重要外交政策問題。

info.requirement:
Not for Government and Public Administration Majors and students who have taken GPAD2350.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Edu Change in Chi Societies 華人社會中的教育變遷

description.ENG: This course mainly introduces, from the comparative perspective, the establishment of modern education system and recent educational reform in The Chinese Mainland, Hong Kong, Taiwan, and Macau.  It aims to help students critically analyze the role of education and major reform issues in the Chinese societies. Major topics include: (1) the establishment of modern schooling; (2) the pursuit of quality education; (3) decentralization and educational reform; (4) curriculum reform; (5) quality assurance mechanism and the rise of schooling market; (6) Internationalization and the establishment of education hub.
description.ZHS: 本科从比较的角度，比较中国大陆、香港、台湾，澳门教育制度的建立以及最新教育改革趋势。本科旨在帮助学生批判思考华人社会中教育的功能以及两岸四地教育改革的主要议题。本科讨论的主要内容包括：（1）现代学校教育制度的建立；（2）优质教育的追寻 (3) 权力下放与教育改革；（4）课程改革（5）质素保证机制与教育市场的兴起;  (6) 国际化与教育枢纽的建立 。
description.ZHT: 本科從比較的角度，比較中國大陸、香港、臺灣，澳門教育制度的建立以及最新教育改革趨勢。本科旨在幫助學生批判思考華人社會中教育的功能以及兩岸四地教育改革的主要議題。本科討論的主要內容包括：（1）現代學校教育制度的建立；（2）優質教育的追尋 (3) 權力下放與教育改革；（4）課程改革（5）質素保證機制與教育市場的興起;  (6) 國際化與教育樞紐的建立 。

info.requirement:
Not for students majoring in programmes offered by Faculty of Education Majors; not for CLED and ELED Majors.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

title.ZHS: 华人社会中的教育变迁
title.ZHT: 華人社會中的教育變遷

-.short_title: Med & Soc Dev in Mainland Chi 中國大陸的媒介與社會發展

description.ENG: (UGEC2634 is double-coded with COMM2140.)   The course is designed around two major themes, namely media and social development in Mainland China since the founding of the People's Republic in 1949.  Using key concepts and theories from the political economy of media and developmental communication studies, it introduces students to different periods of media reform and social change from the era of Chairman Mao to the period of "harmonious society".  Emphasis is attached to post-1989 media regulatory systems, media industrialization, and their influence on the meeting of such developmental goals as poverty alleviation, democratization, and communication empowerment.The course will examine Mainland China's key media sectors including the printing press (newspapers and magazines), film and broadcasting media (radio and TV), and new networked communication tools (Internet and mobile phone) as well as alternative social formations through Internet activism, non-governmental organizations (NGOs) and transnational developmental projects.  The course will identify and discuss several ongoing debates, and the ensuing actions, held by different stakeholders, including governmental officials, media producers, educators, activists, international agencies, and the general audiences. Wider implications to public policy will be identified.  There will also be discussions of current affairs related to media and social development in the country.Students will be able to describe the key characteristics of contemporary Mainland Chinese media and their roles in facilitating or obstructing development towards the ideals of a "new China".
description.ZHS: (UGEC2634与COMM2140列为双重编号科目。)      本科以1949年以来中国大陆的媒介和社会发展为探讨对象，旨在应用媒体政治经济学与发展传播学的核心概念，介绍学生了解从毛时代到“和谐社会”不同时期大陆媒介改革与社会变迁之间的关系。讨论重点是1989年以来的媒介管理体系、媒体产业化及其对社会发展目标（如扶贫、民主化、传播赋权）的各种影响。    课程内容涵盖中国大陆的主要媒介行业，如印刷媒体（报纸、杂志）、广播电影电视、网络媒体（互联网、手机），也包括网上动员、非政府组织与跨国发展项目等替代性发展趋势。课程会介绍和分析主要相关争论，包括政府官员、媒体制作人、教育界、社会运动参与者、国际机构及一般观众等不同社群在争议中所持的观点，以及它们对公共政策的影响。本课还将引导学生对相关中国时事进行讨论。    在修读本科后，学生应加深了解当代中国大陆媒介的特点，及其对实现“新中国”发展理想所起的促进或阻碍作用。
description.ZHT: (UGEC2634與COMM2140列為雙重編號科目。)  本課以1949年以來中國大陸的媒介和社會發展為探討對象，旨在應用媒體政治經濟學與發展傳播學的核心概念，介紹學生了解從毛時代到“和諧社會”不同時期大陸媒介改革與社會變遷之間的關係。討論重點是1989年以來的媒介管理體系、媒體產業化及其對社會發展目標（如扶貧、民主化、傳播賦權）的各種影響。課程內容涵蓋中國大陸的主要媒介行業，如印刷媒體（報紙、雜誌）、廣播電影電視、網絡媒體（互聯網、手機），也包括網上動員、非政府組織與跨國發展項目等替代性發展趨勢。課程會介紹和分析主要相關爭論，包括政府官員、媒體製作人、教育界、社會運動參與者、國際機構及一般觀眾等不同社群在爭議中所持的觀點，以及它們對公共政策的影響。本課還將引導學生對相關中國時事進行討論。在修讀本科後，學生應加深了解當代中國大陸媒介的特點，及其對實現“新中國”發展理想所起的促進或阻礙作用。

info.requirement:
Not for Journalism and Communication Majors and students who have taken COMM2140.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

title.ENG: Media and Social Development in Mainland China
title.ZHS: 中国大陆的媒介与社会发展
title.ZHT: 中國大陸的媒介與社會發展

-.short_title: Hong Kong Society 香港社會

description.ENG: From the “borrowed time and borrowed place”, Hong Kong has evolved into a global city with its own identity. Since the 1950s, the city experienced an economic miracle, withstood numerous financial crises, and is in the process of economic restructuring. Politically, it has turned from “the last Colony” of Great Britain into a Special Administrative Region of the PRC. Culturally, the flourishing Canto pop-culture coincides with the emergence of a local identity. Using a sociological perspective, this course investigates the impact of these profound changes on individuals, families, ethnic groups, and society.
description.ZHS: 香港从前被喻为「借来的时间，借来的地方」。自二十世纪五十年代起，香港渐渐演变成为一个有本土意识的国际大都会。此其间，香港社会创造了经济奇迹，克服过多次的金融风暴冲击，如今其经济正在转型。政治上，香港由大英帝国「最后一个殖民地」回归成中华人民共和国的一个特别行政区。本土普及文化兴起，成为了民众的集体记忆。本科采用社会学角度，探讨上述多面向的变迁，对个人、家庭、小区、不同族群以致社会整体的影响。
description.ZHT: 香港從前被喻為「借來的時間，借來的地方」。自二十世紀五十年代起，香港漸漸演變成為一個有本土意識的國際大都會。此其間，香港社會創造了經濟奇蹟，克服過多次的金融風暴衝擊，如今其經濟正在轉型。政治上，香港由大英帝國「最後一個殖民地」回歸成中華人民共和國的一個特別行政區。本土普及文化興起，成為了民眾的集體記憶。本科採用社會學角度，探討上述多面向的變遷，對個人、家庭、社區、不同族群以致社會整體的影響。

info.requirement:
Not for Sociology Majors and students who have taken GEJC1020, SOCI1201 or 2104.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

A.short_title: Logic 邏輯

B.short_title: Logic 邏輯

C.short_title: Logic 邏輯

description.ENG: This course is designed to develop the student's ability to analyze and critically evaluate arguments from a logical point of view. It will provide students with a basic understanding of such concepts as reasons, implication, validity, and fallacies. Students will learn the logical principles of deductive and inductive inferences and the techniques of applying them for determining the validity of arguments. Elements of good reasoning from an informal perspective will also be covered.
description.ZHS: （哲学主副修生及已修 PHI1310 /  UGD111A / UGD180A 或 UGD181A之学生不得选修本科作通识教育科目。）     本科提供基本的逻辑学训练，培养学生的逻辑思辨及提升其分析和评监各类论证的能力。除了逻辑学的基本概念外（例如：理由、涵蕴、对确、谬误等），本科主要教授演绎推论和归纳推论的逻辑原则及其应用的方法，并讨论非形式逻辑的推理原则。
description.ZHT: 本科提供基本的邏輯學訓練，培養學生的邏輯思辨及提升其分析和評鑑各類論證的能力。除了邏輯學的基本概念外（例如：理由、涵蘊、對確、謬誤等），本科主要教授演繹推論和歸納推論的邏輯原則及其應用的方法，並討論非形式邏輯的推理原則。

info.requirement:
Not for Philosophy Majors and students who have taken PHIL1310, UGED1112, UGED1800 or UGED1810.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Mastering Service Excellence 掌控優質服務

description.ENG: In the business world, service quality is a crucial factor that affects customer satisfaction, which in turn, contributes to an organization’s competitiveness and performance. The importance of service excellence has long been recognized in hospitality, tourism, retailing and other service industries. But every business is a service business, and the trend towards a “global service economy” suggests that all university students, regardless of their major areas, will be benefited from understanding the concept of service excellence and learning to design / implement strategies to deliver outstanding services. Students will also be better prepared for their careers by learning communication skills needed in effective customer interactions.  This course teaches the best customer service practices aimed to meet customer needs and even exceed customer expectations. It is designed to equip students with a service mindset, an awareness of the nature and characteristics of services, and an understanding of the specific ways to market intangible service products. The knowledge and skills learned in this course should be applicable to different industries. Theories and practices will be taught in a dynamic learning environment that features lectures, experiential training activities, case discussions and interactions on the University’s e-learning platforms.
description.ZHS: 助人为乐是优质服务之要义。在商业环境中，服务质素是影响顾客满意度、组织竞争力与积效的重要因素。酒店，餐饮，旅游，零售等服务行业早已认识到优质服务的重要性，不过今天我们也许可以说每个行业都是服务行业，在 “全球服务经济” 的趋势之下，了解优质服务这一概念，学习规划/实施优质服务策略，对任何学科领域的学生都将有极大帮助。学习与顾客沟通的技巧也可以帮助学生更好地发展未来职业生涯。本科教授旨在满足顾客需要，甚至超越顾客预期的最佳服务实践。本科有助于学生建立服务意识，了解服务之特性，并学习宣传推广 “无形” 服务的策略。在本科所学的知识与技能适用于各个行业。 教学方法强调动态与互动，学生将透过课堂教学，体验式游戏，案例讨论，网上平台互动等方式学习服务理论与实践。
description.ZHT: 助人為樂是優質服務之要義。在商業環境中，服務質素是影響顧客滿意度、組織競爭力與積效的重要因素。酒店，餐飲，旅遊，零售等服務行業早已認識到優質服務的重要性，不過今天我們也許可以說每個行業都是服務行業，在 “全球服務經濟” 的趨勢之下，了解優質服務這一概念，學習規劃/實施優質服務策略，對任何學科領域的學生都將有極大助益。學習與顧客溝通的技巧也可以幫助學生更好地發展未來職業生涯。本科教授旨在滿足顧客需要，甚至超越顧客預期的最佳服務實踐。本科有助於學生建立服務意識，了解服務之特性，并學習宣傳推廣 “無形” 服務的策略。在本科所學的知識與技能適用於各個行業。 教學方法強調動態與互動，學生將透過課堂教學，體驗式遊戲，案例討論，網上平台互動等方式學習服務理論與實踐。

info.requirement:
Not for Hotel and Tourism Management Majors.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Understanding Movies 認識電影

description.ENG: (UGEd2637 is double-coded with COMM2930.)This course aims at helping students to earn a solid vocabulary and a sharp eye in analyzing films. Students will learn about the basic cinematic techniques and structures, including mise-en-scene and montage, use of cinematic time and space, the image, soundtrack, and the script. Theoretical perspectives such as realism, feminism, postmodernism would be introduced to address the political, economic and socio-cultural implications of movies. Equipped with these analytical tools, students can critically appreciate movies of different era and different places.
description.ZHS: （UGED2637与COMM2930列为双重编号科目。）本科教授电影语言及不同理论如写实主义丶女性主义丶後现代主义，引导学生欣赏丶批判及思考电影美学及其政治丶经济及文化含义。学生将接触不同时代不同国家的经典及当代电影，学习解读各种主题和关注点，并了解电影如何作为文化载体及社会实践。
description.ZHT: （UGED2637與COMM2930列為雙重編號科目。）本科教授電影語言及不同理論如寫實主義、女性主義、後現代主義，引導學生欣賞、批判及思考電影美學及其政治、經濟及文化含義。學生將接觸不同時代不同國家的經典及當代電影，學習解讀各種主題和關注點，並了解電影如何作為文化載體及社會實踐。

info.requirement:
Not for Journalism and Communication Majors and students who have taken COMM2930.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

B.short_title: Reflections on Everyday Life 日常生活的反思

description.ENG: This course provides an opportunity for students to reflect on the formation of "self" in society and how the society affects our understanding of love, sex, work, death and meaning of life. Selected references in sociology, psychology, religion and literature will be introduced to provide a board intellectual perspective to understand the complex relationships between self and society. Students are expected to acquire an ability to analyze and critique on how different social institutions such as education, religion, family, media, state, etc., affect our attitude and behaviors in some essential issues of life such as mate choice. Following the tradition of critical theory, this course assumes that this reflection is the first step for liberating from "bad faith" and living an authentic life.The grade descriptors for this course are as follows:Grade A: Outstanding performance on all learning outcomes. Grade A-: Generally outstanding performance on all (or almost all) learning outcomes. Grade B: Substantial performance on all learning outcomes, OR high performance on some learning outcomes which compensates for less satisfactory performance on others, resulting in overall substantial performance. Grade C: Satisfactory performance on the majority of learning outcomes, possibly with a few weaknesses. Grade D: Barely satisfactory performance on a number of learning outcomes.Grade F: Unsatisfactory performance on a number of learning outcomes, OR failure to meet specified assessment requirement.
description.ZHS: 此科目提供学生机会反思"自我"如何形成和我们如何受社会影响对情爱、性、工作、死亡和人生意义的看法。为了提供学生一个广阔的视野去审视自我与社会的关系，本科会介绍来自社会学、心理学、宗教和文学的相关作品。本科期望学生最终懂得分析和批判教育、宗教、家庭、传媒、政治等社会制度如何影响我们在一些人生领域（如择偶）的思想与行为。本科秉承批判理论的传统，相信这种反思是人们从"自我蒙骗"中解放出来、真实地活出自我的开端。本科之等级说明(grade descriptors)可参阅英文版科目简介(course description)。
description.ZHT: 此科目提供學生機會反思"自我"如何形成和我們如何受社會影響對情愛、性、工作、死亡和人生意義的看法。為了提供學生一個廣闊的視野去審視自我與社會的關係，本科會介紹來自社會學、心理學、宗教和文學的相關作品。本科期望學生最終懂得分析和批判教育、宗教、家庭、傳媒、政治等社會制度如何影響我們在一些人生領域（如擇偶）的思想與行為。本科秉承批判理論的傳統，相信這種反思是人們從"自我蒙騙"中解放出來、真實地活出自我的開端。本科之等級說明(grade descriptors)可參閱英文版科目簡介(course description)。

info.requirement:
Not for Sociology Majors and students who have taken SOCI1202(2109).
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

-.short_title: Love and Intimate Relationship 愛情與親密關係

description.ENG: (UGED3208 is double-coded with GDRS3004.)This course reviews basic concepts, theories and research findings of romantic love and intimate relationship from the perspective of psychology of gender. Various aspects of romantic love and intimate relationship will be critically reviewed. Based on most-updated research of psychology of gender, we will cover major areas such as the following: different stages in the development of love; interpersonal processes within romantic relationships (such as conversation, conflict, etc.); the role of sexuality in love; gender differences in romantic feelings and behaviors; break-ups and divorce, etc. Upon completion of the course, students should demonstrate basic understanding of structure, functions, dynamics, and development of romantic love and use knowledge from this course as an insight to improve the quality of their own relationships in the future.
description.ZHS: (UGED3208与GDRS3004列为双重编号科目。)本科从性别心理学的角度出发，检阅爱情与亲密关系的基本概念、理论和研究成果。并讨论爱情与亲密关系的各种方面。根据最新的性别心理学研究，我们将涵盖以下范畴：爱情的不同阶段、亲密关系的人际交往过程（如对话，冲突等）、性在爱情的作用、浪漫感觉与行为的性别差异、分手和离婚等。完成本科后，同学应对爱情与亲密关系的结构、功能、动态与发展有基本的了解，并可以在日常生活中應用這些知識。
description.ZHT: (UGED3208與GDRS3004列為雙重編號科目。)本科從性別心理學的角度出發，檢閱愛情與親密關係的基本概念、理論和研究成果。並討論愛情與親密關係的各種方面。根據最新的性別心理學研究，我們將涵蓋以下範疇：愛情的不同階段、親密關係的人際交往過程（如對話，衝突等）、性在愛情的作用、浪漫感覺與行為的性別差異、分手和離婚等。完成本科後，同學應對愛情與親密關係的結構、功能、動態與發展有基本的了解，並可以在日常生活中應用這些知識。

info.requirement:
Not for Gender Studies Majors and students who have taken GDRS3004.
Co-requisite: UGFH1000 or UGFN1000 (only applicable to students admitted to the 4-year curriculum).

A.short_title: In Dialogue with Humanity 與人文對話

B.short_title: In Dialogue with Humanity 與人文對話

C.short_title: In Dialogue with Humanity 與人文對話

D.short_title: In Dialogue with Humanity 與人文對話

E.short_title: In Dialogue with Humanity 與人文對話

J.short_title: In Dialogue with Humanity 與人文對話

K.short_title: In Dialogue with Humanity 與人文對話

P.short_title: In Dialogue with Humanity 與人文對話

description.ENG: The course invites students to investigate the problem of "humanity"—i.e., what it means to be human—at two levels: human as an individual and human as a social being. Students will be engaged in a direct dialogue with literary writers, philosophers and social reformers who address three fundamental questions: What is it that makes a "good" life for me? What is it that makes a "good" society for everyone? How do I make possible such a "good" life and "good" society? Students are expected to read, discuss, and write about a wide range of texts extracted from influential classics in the humanities East and West. They will be encouraged to discover their own answers to the three questions by considering views and arguments expressed in the texts, and by exploring how far and in what ways such views and arguments may hold true for the contemporary world.Where appropriate, the selected classic texts will be given bilingually to help students enter the world of classics and develop confidence and competence in approaching primary texts. Students will meet for one lecture and two tutorial sessions every week. Emphasis will be placed on students’ capacity to respond critically to the selected texts in oral and written presentations, in the form of class discussions, short write-ups and term papers. Class size will be kept small to maximize discussions and to facilitate intensive guidance on academic writing, in Chinese and/or English as specified by the instructor.
description.ZHS: 本科邀请同学探讨「人文」的意义，思索人的本质与核心价值问题。探索会从个人和社会两个层面进行，确认人是追求个人幸福的独立个体，也是谋求群体福祉的社会一员。同学将与文学家、哲学家、社会改革家的作品展开直接对话，一同反思三个基本问题﹕美好的人生应包含甚么内容？理想的社会应具备甚么条件？美好人生与理想社会如何获致？  本科从不同的人文学科，挑选影响深远的中外经典著作，辑录篇章，供同学阅读、讨论及撰文分析。同学将逐一审视各篇章所提出的观点和理念，估量它在当代世界是否仍真确适用；同学须针对以上三个问题，寻找自己的答案。  导师会尽量提供中英对照的文本，帮助同学进入经典的世界，提升读原典、论原典的信心和能力。教学活动为每周一节讲课、两节导修；同学须发挥批判思维，就指定篇章进行课堂讨论，并提交短写和论文，表达个人的见解，深化讨论。为确保学员有充分机会参与课堂讨论，并在学术论文书写方面得到适当的指导，课堂以导修课为主，每组学生人数有严格限制。论文应按导师要求以英文或中文书写。
description.ZHT: 本科邀請同學探討「人文」的意義，思索人的本質與核心價值問題。探索會從個人和社會兩個層面進行，確認人是追求個人幸福的獨立個體，也是謀求群體福祉的社會一員。同學將與文學家、哲學家、社會改革家的作品展開直接對話，一同反思三個基本問題﹕美好的人生應包含甚麼內容？理想的社會應具備甚麼條件？美好人生與理想社會如何獲致？本科從不同的人文學科，挑選影響深遠的中外經典著作，輯錄篇章，供同學閱讀、討論及撰文分析。同學將逐一審視各篇章所提出的觀點和理念，估量它在當代世界是否仍真確適用；同學須針對以上三個問題，尋找自己的答案。導師會盡量提供中英對照的文本，幫助同學進入經典的世界，提升讀原典、論原典的信心和能力。教學活動為每週一節講課、兩節導修；同學須發揮批判思維，就指定篇章進行課堂討論，並提交短寫和論文，表達個人的見解，深化討論。為確保學員有充分機會參與課堂討論，並在學術論文書寫方面得到適當的指導，課堂以導修課為主，每組學生人數有嚴格限制。論文應按導師要求以英文或中文書寫。

A.short_title: In Dialogue With Nature 與自然對話

B.short_title: In Dialogue With Nature 與自然對話

C.short_title: In Dialogue With Nature 與自然對話

E.short_title: In Dialogue With Nature 與自然對話

J.short_title: In Dialogue With Nature 與自然對話

P.short_title: In Dialogue With Nature 與自然對話

description.ENG: Humans have long been curious about Nature. In the West, ancient Greek philosophers took the lead in exploring the physical world and the world of life with reason and hence laid the foundations of modern science. Scientists discovered physical laws, the laws governing life and even ways of controlling life. Implications of these discoveries force the humankind to re-assess their understanding of human understanding. On the oriental side of the globe, Chinese philosophers developed a different view of Nature. The comparison between Western and Chinese views will contribute to our understanding of both.This course invites students to explore how the humankind investigated, understood and changed Nature, to study and compare the development of science in Western and Chinese cultures, and to reflect on the humans’ place in Nature. Students will be required to read, discuss and write about a wide range of texts in philosophy, science and its history. Reading materials will be selected from influential literatures. Emphasis will be placed on students’ capacity to respond critically to these texts in written as well as oral presentations.
description.ZHS: 自远古开始，人类就对大自然充满好奇。古希腊哲人开展了以理性探索物理世界和生命世界的传统，为现代科学奠定了基础。科学家发现了物理定律、生命法则，甚至控制生命的方法。这些发现，促使我们重新审视人类如何理解自己的理解。在地球的这一边，中国哲人却发展了一套与西方不同的世界观。比较中西世界观，将会加深我们对两者的认识。本科让同学认识并比较中西科学发展，了解人类如何探索、认识，以至改变大自然，认识及比较科学在西方和中国的发展，并反思人在大自然中的地位。老师将从多部影响深远的典籍中，选辑一系列篇章，供学员阅读和分析。这些篇章涉及哲学、科学及其历史等不同范畴。本科着重提升同学读原典、论原典的能力。同学须发挥批判思维，就指定篇章进行深入讨论，并提交论文，表述个人反思和分析的结果。
description.ZHT: 自遠古開始，人類就對大自然充滿好奇。古希臘哲人開展了以理性探索物理世界和生命世界的傳統，為現代科學奠定了基礎。科學家發現了物理定律、生命法則，甚至控制生命的方法。這些發現，促使我們重新審視人類如何理解自己的理解。在地球的這一邊，中國哲人卻發展了一套與西方不同的世界觀。比較中西世界觀，將會加深我們對兩者的認識。本科讓同學認識並比較中西科學發展，了解人類如何探索、認識，以至改變大自然，認識及比較科學在西方和中國的發展，並反思人在大自然中的地位。老師將從多部影響深遠的典籍中，選輯一系列篇章，供學員閱讀和分析。這些篇章涉及哲學、科學及其歷史等不同範疇。本科著重提升同學讀原典、論原典的能力。同學須發揮批判思維，就指定篇章進行深入討論，並提交論文，表述個人反思和分析的結果。

-.short_title: Urban Sustainability 城市可持續發展

description.ENG: This course explores theories and practices pertaining to urban sustainability, focusing on the fundamental issue that gives rise to the notion of sustainability—the integrity of the Earth’s life-supporting system. It examines global and local environmental issues, as well as consequential socioeconomic problems, arising from urban development and continuous urban growth. It also explores existing and emerging approaches to urban sustainability. Throughout the course, students will be challenged to contemplate on the core of the quest of urban sustainability—the relationship between humans and nature.
description.ZHS: 本科探讨都市可持续发展相关的理论与实务，特别强调可持续发展的中心课题：地球维生系统的健全。本科介绍都市发展与持续成长所造成的问题，包括全球性与地方性的环境问题与生态危机，以及其社会与经济影响；此外，也讨论当前的解决方案。透过这堂课，学生学习深入反思都市可持续发展的中心课题：人与自然的关系。
description.ZHT: 本科探討都市可持續發展相關的理論與實務，特別強調可持續發展的中心課題：地球維生系統的健全。本科介紹都市發展與持續成長所造成的問題，包括全球性與地方性的環境問題與生態危機，以及其社會與經濟影響；此外，也討論當前的解決方案。透過這堂課，學生學習深入反思都市可持續發展的中心課題：人與自然的關係。

-.short_title: Field Studies I 實地考察（一）

description.ENG: Field teaching is an integral part in the study of the urban world, which gives students an opportunity to understand the real-world situations and to supplement what they have learnt from the lectures. This course is designed in the format of a study trip in Hong Kong or a big overseas city. The objectives are three-fold: (1) to introduce students to different techniques in the collection of field data; (2) to help students identify, understand and explain urban problems; and (3) to provide an opportunity for students to work as a team in problem-solving. Students are required to participate actively in all activities throughout the study trip and to submit an individual report afterwards.
description.ZHS: 实地教学让学生有机会去认识真实世界的状况，以补充他们从课堂所得到的知识，是学习城巿不可或缺的一部分。学生会在香港或一个海外城巿进行考察活动。本科目有三大目的：（一）让学生学习用不同方法收集实地数据；（二）帮助学生识别、明白及解释城巿问题；及（三）让学生有机会在小组运作中学习解决问题。同学需要积极参与所有活动及提交个人报告。
description.ZHT: 實地教學讓學生有機會去認識真實世界的狀況，以補充他們從課堂所得到的知識，是學習城巿不可或缺的一部分。學生會在香港或一個海外城巿進行考察活動。本科目有三大目的：（一）讓學生學習用不同方法收集實地數據；（二）幫助學生識別、明白及解釋城巿問題；及（三）讓學生有機會在小組運作中學習解決問題。同學需要積極參與所有活動及提交個人報告。

-.short_title: Field Studies II 實地考察（二）

description.ENG: The field studies concentrate on the understanding of places through direct observation and personal experience. The course gives opportunity to study specific urban settings and their spatial and cultural contexts. Students analyse on-site the impact of design and planning decisions on liveability, vitality and sense of place. The course trains techniques of documentation and analysis such as mapping, drawing and photographing. The field studies are conducted in Hong Kong, mainland China or overseas according to specific themes.
description.ZHS: 实地考察强调直接观察及个人经歷去体验了解一个地方。本科让学生有机会研究不同的空间及文化背景，如何造就城巿环境。学生会实地分析设计及规划的决定如何影响一个地方的怡居环境、活力及其独特气质。本科训練学生绘制地图，绘画及摄影的存盘方法及分析技巧。实地考察的地点会因应特定的主题而定于香港、中国或海外地区进行。
description.ZHT: 實地考察強調直接觀察及個人經歷去體驗了解一個地方。本科讓學生有機會研究不同的空間及文化背景，如何造就城巿環境。學生會實地分析設計及規劃的決定如何影響一個地方的怡居環境、活力及其獨特氣質。本科訓練學生繪製地圖，繪畫及攝影的存檔方法及分析技巧。實地考察的地點會因應特定的主題而定於香港、中國或海外地區進行。

info.requirement: Prerequisite: URSP2500.
